.25 in. galangal piece; peeled, cut into 3/4 cm / 1/2" slices
medium-small potatoes; peeled and cut into 2.5cm / 1" pieces
sweet potatoes; peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks
whole tomatoes with juices; (28-ounce), San Marzano if possible
finely-diced yellow onion; about 1/2 medium or 1 small
coarse salt; for rimming the glass
gave nectar; or simple syrup, to taste
orange liqueur; (Cointreau, Grand Marnier or Triple Sec)
thinly sliced green onions; plus more for garnish
dried short pasta; such as macaroni
shredded cheese; such as cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Colby
Vegetable or canola oil; for frying
of pasta; bowtie pasta or any pasta of choice, I like linguine
Freshly ground black pepper; to taste
cooked lobster meat; broken into chunks
dry white wine; such as Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay or Sauvignon Blanc (see note)
lemon juice; from 1 lemon, plus more to taste
lemon zest; from 1 lemon, plus more to taste
fresh flat-leaf parsley; finely chopped (plus 2 tablespoons)
asparagus; trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
asparagus; trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
Butter; (for putting on the griddle or skillet)
Fresh Lemon Zest; (about the zest from 1 lemon)
yellow onion; peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
carrots; peeled and cut into 2 or 3-inch pieces
low-sodium chicken broth; plus more as needed

recipe.title: Creamy One Pot Coconut Butternut Squash Ramen

ingredient.item: dried noodles; (300g) (instant ramen bricks, udon, or egg noodles are best)
peanut butter; (ideally natural peanut butter, with only peanuts and salt in the ingredients list)
fish sauce; (optional, or use more soy sauce for vegetarian)
